comment.body:
> ### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
> [https://bleacherreport.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fbleacherreport.com%2F)
> 
> ### Comment
> > Hi there 👋
> > I've had Adguard installed on Android and Windows 11 Chrome browser (the AG browser extension, not the system AG app) for a while, but this glitch accessing Bleacherreport.com ("something went wrong - try reloading" message) wasn't noticed til the last couple of weeks...
> > I reported it to the site's support department, and they mentioned that they couldn't reproduce it on their end and suggested it could be VPN-related - however I don't have a vpn running while trying to access the site on either platform.
> > Disabling the extension and mobile app do seem to fix the error message. It should be noted that adding the site to the "Allowlist" in the browser extension does not work.
> > Thanks for any guidance.
> 
> Username: `@GitAlexToTheGreek`
> 
> ### Screenshots
> Screenshot 1
> Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled
> ### System configuration
> Information	Value
> AdGuard product:	AdGuard Browser Extension v5.0.210 MV3
> System version:	Windows 11
> Browser:	Chrome
> Tracking protection options:	Strip URLs from tracking parameters,
> Hide your search queries,
> Send Do-Not-Track header,
> Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests,
> Self-destructing third-party cookies (2880),
> Block trackers
> Filters:	Ad blocking:
> AdGuard Base
> 
> Privacy:
> AdGuard Tracking Protection,
> AdGuard URL Tracking
> 
> Annoyances:
> AdGuard Cookie Notices,
> AdGuard Popups,
> AdGuard Mobile App Banners,
> AdGuard Other Annoyances
> 
> Language-specific:
> AdGuard French
> Browsing Security:	disabled
> Browsing Security statistics:	disabled
> Other extensions used:	Bitdefender Antivirus Free Build 27.0.49.250, Extensions: AdGuard, Bitwarden, Dark Reader, Enhancer For YouTube, Extensity, Free Download Manager, Read Aloud, Scrolling Screenshot & Full Page Markup App, Selection Search

Can confirm that after testing yesterday, the website operates as expected on both Windows desktop Chrome browser and Android Chrome browser app.

Thanks to those who addressed this, much appreciated. 🙂👍

pull_request.title: Fix #201768 redecanais.ms
pull_request.body:
Fix https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/201768

The anti adblock needs to unblock `https://naupsithizeekee.com/tag.min.js` which is a legitimate ad script. Should we make exceptions for platforms that don't support scriptlets?

comment.body:
> 如果用户无法使用，该网站的目的是什么？

Users are still able to use this site, but it's easy to accidentally bump into the ad at the bottom and jump to another site, which requires a lot of care, which is why I am very annoyed. This site has a lot of fiction books that other sites don't have, and it's irreplaceable. Otherwise, I'll just switch to another website
I see. Thanks. I've updated the rule.

issue.title: tracking from digidip.net on dealabs.com

labels.name: T: Analytics
labels.description: Collecting analytics and tracking users

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Some sites (such as dealabs.com, to quote one I know) track by passing each clicks through advertising agencies.
With the new version of the $urltransform tool, you can finally “clean up” the links.

Here are a few examples:

https://dealabs.digidip.net/visit?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.lycamobile.fr%2Ffr%2Fbundle%2Fforfait-lyca-s-plus-200gb%2F&ppref=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dealabs.com%2F&ref=ppr-fr-1714412352

to gives https://www.lycamobile.fr/fr/bundle/forfait-lyca-s-plus-200gb/

https://dealabs.digidip.net/visit?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cdiscount.com%2Finformatique%2Fssd%2Fssd-interne-samsung-990-evo-plus-2-to-nvme-m%2Ff-10703-sam8806095575650.html&ppref=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dealabs.com%2Fsearch%3Fq%3Deffiliation.com&ref=ppr-fr-1714418097

to give https://www.cdiscount.com/informatique/ssd/ssd-interne-samsung-990-evo-plus-2-to-nvme-m/f-10703-sam8806095575650.html

### Proposed solution

```
/^https?:\/\/(?:[a-z0-9-]+\.)*?dealabs\.digidip\.net\/visit\?url=/$urltransform=/%3A/:/
/^https?:\/\/(?:[a-z0-9-]+\.)*?dealabs\.digidip\.net\/visit\?url=/$urltransform=/%2F/\//
/^https?:\/\/(?:[a-z0-9-]+\.)*?dealabs\.digidip\.net\/visit\?url=/$urltransform=/%3F/?/
/^https?:\/\/(?:[a-z0-9-]+\.)*?dealabs\.digidip\.net\/visit\?url=/$urltransform=/%3D/=/
/^https?:\/\/(?:[a-z0-9-]+\.)*?dealabs\.digidip\.net\/visit\?url=/$urltransform=/^https?:\/\/(?:[a-z0-9-]+\.)*?dealabs\.digidip\.net.*url=([^&]*).*/\$1/
```

The first 4 rules are only for decoding special characters, as the $urltransform tool unfortunately can't do this ([yet](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/CoreLibs/issues/1915)). When it does, these rules could be removed.

KR,





### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body:
@Alex-302 Hello,
I see that a solution has been found for the filter compilation bug.  And indeed, the rules no longer appear in the diff.txt, which seems to include the rules that were “blocked” or blocking.
But I can't seem to find the rules in one of the official Adguard filters. Is there still something to wait for? 

Thanks in advance

comment.body:
Unfortunately, I cannot reproduce it.
As far as I can see, it should be hidden by this rule:
```adblock
skype.com,microsoft.com,setup.office.com,rewards.bing.com,github.blog,github.com###wcpConsentBannerCtrl
```

Do you still see this cookie notice?
If so, please try to add mentioned rule to user rules.

comment.body:
I think that should be the same on desktop if you have faced it on mobile. Could you please check it on the desktop in Chrome with AdGuard for Chrome?
I see the requests from the domains are blocked.
```
mmstat.com
alicdn.com
taobao.com
```
Please do the following:
1. Install Chrome, then AdGuard for Chrome from Chrome Web Store
2. Go to the extension settings, leave only AdGuard Tracking Protection
3. Open the filtering log from the menu by clicking on the extension logo
4. Leave only `blocked` requests in the FL, keep it in the background
5. Reproduce the problem
6. Open the FL, select the necessary tab - you will see blocked requests
7. Whitelist the requests one by one to find a problematic one, then check the site. So, that way - unblock one request, check the site, and so on.

This will help to understand which one was the cause.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.amazon.co.jp/gp/r.html](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.co.jp%2Fgp%2Fr.html) ### Comment > 返品画面(`https://www.amazon.co.jp/gp/r.html?…`と続くURL)を開くと、本来は返品受付センターという返品の進捗を確認する画面(`https://www.amazon.co.jp/spr/returns/confirmation/…`と続くURL)にリダイレクトします。 > しかし、AdGuard URL Tracking filterを有効にしていると、返品受付センターへリダイレクトが起こらず、返品を開始する画面(返品物の選択画面)に遷移してしまいます。 > そのため、返品の進捗が確認できなくなってしまっています。 > この問題は、Actually Legitimate URL Shortener Toolを有効にした時にも発生しました。 ### Screenshots

comment.body:
It seems that it's related to `Global Privacy Control` and content of the response looks like:
```json
{
 "eventWasPublished": false,
 "reasonNotPublished": "GPC_COUNTRY_NOT_DETECTED"
}
```
 so I'm not sure if it should be blocked.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://chatgpt.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchatgpt.com%2F) ### Comment > ### Bug Report: Sora and Project Folders Disappear When Enabling "Filter HTTPS" in AdGuard > > #### Description > When enabling the **"Filter HTTPS"** option in **Network settings** of AdGuard, the **Sora and Project folders** disappear. This issue occurs consistently when the setting is turned on. > > #### Steps to Reproduce > 1. Open **AdGuard** and go to **Settings**. > 2. Navigate to the **Network** section. > 3. Enable the **"Filter HTTPS"** option. > 4. Observe that the **Sora and Project folders** disappear. > > #### Expected Behavior > The Sora and Project folders should remain visible and accessible even when **"Filter HTTPS"** is enabled. > > #### Actual Behavior > As soon as **"Filter HTTPS"** is enabled, the folders disappear. > > #### Additional Information > - **OS Version**: Win 11 pro Build 26100.3476 > - **AdGuard Version**: 7.20.2 (4988) > > #### Workaround > Disabling **"Filter HTTPS"** restores the Sora and Project folders, but this is not an ideal solution as HTTPS filtering is needed. > Additionally, adding **chatgpt.com** to the **User Filter** does not resolve the issue. > > > Username: `@AbhishekBasnet` ### Screenshots

issue.title: Altibox.no - Broken functions (AdGuard Annoyances filter) [GDPR]
issue.body:
### Affected site:
`https://www.altibox.no/`

### Issue:
Various functions, like confirming your TV and/or internet subscription contents, doesn't work, due to a blocked cookie consent, which needs to be accepted!

(To reproduce, you need to be logged in to an account)

### Blocked assets:
```
https://policy.app.cookieinformation.com/*/altibox.no/*.js
https://policy.app.cookieinformation.com/uc.js
```

### Problem filter:
* **AdGuard Annoyances filter**

### Problem rule:
`||policy*.cookieinformation.com^$third-party`

### Possible fix:
`@@||policy.app.cookieinformation.com^$script,domain=altibox.no`

### Other problem filters:
* **Easylist Cookie List** / **Fanboy's Annoyance List** ( https://github.com/easylist/easylist/issues/7805/ )
`###coiOverlay[role="banner"][style*="flex"]`
`||cookieinformation.com/*/*.js`

* ~~**I don't care about cookies** _(NOTIFIED)_~~ _(FIXED)_
~~`policy.app.cookieinformation.com$domain=~kartor.eniro.se|~kart.gulesider.no|~kort.degulesider.dk|~map.krak.dk|~babysam.dk|~minaftale.dk`~~

--

### System info:
* OS/version: Windows 8.1 Pro (x64)
* Browser/version: Pale Moon v29.2.0 (x64)
* Adblock Extension/version: uBlock Origin v1.16.4.28 (XUL)

comment.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://mail.yandex.ru/?nocache=718&uid=166575526#inbox](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmail.yandex.ru%2F%3Fnocache%3D718%26uid%3D166575526%23inbox) ### Comment > В последнее время рекламу регулярно вижу в режиме открытого письма, когда письмо закрываю, реклама пропадает, но сегодня реклама перестала пропадать, когда закроешь письмо. issue.title: gmarket.co.kr

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Windows

### AdGuard version

7.20.2

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed analytics or tracker

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

This issue occurs consistently when the setting is turned on. > > #### Steps to Reproduce > 1. Open **AdGuard** and go to **Settings**. > 2. Navigate to the **Network** section. > 3. Enable the **"Filter HTTPS"** option. > 4. issue.title: tracking from digidip.net on dealabs.com

labels.name: T: Analytics
labels.description: Collecting analytics and tracking users

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Some sites (such as dealabs.com, to quote one I know) track by passing each clicks through advertising agencies.
With the new version of the $urltransform tool, you can finally “clean up” the links.

Here are a few examples:

https://dealabs.digidip.net/visit?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.lycamobile.fr%2Ffr%2Fbundle%2Fforfait-lyca-s-plus-200gb%2F&ppref=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dealabs.com%2F&ref=ppr-fr-1714412352

to gives https://www.lycamobile.fr/fr/bundle/forfait-lyca-s-plus-200gb/

https://dealabs.digidip.net/visit?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cdiscount.com%2Finformatique%2Fssd%2Fssd-interne-samsung-990-evo-plus-2-to-nvme-m%2Ff-10703-sam8806095575650.html&ppref=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dealabs.com%2Fsearch%3Fq%3Deffiliation.com&ref=ppr-fr-1714418097

to give https://www.cdiscount.com/informatique/ssd/ssd-interne-samsung-990-evo-plus-2-to-nvme-m/f-10703-sam8806095575650.html

### Proposed solution

```
/^https?:\/\/(?:[a-z0-9-]+\.)*?dealabs\.digidip\.net\/visit\?url=/$urltransform=/%3A/:/
/^https?:\/\/(?:[a-z0-9-]+\.)*?dealabs\.digidip\.net\/visit\?url=/$urltransform=/%2F/\//
/^https?:\/\/(?:[a-z0-9-]+\.)*?dealabs\.digidip\.net\/visit\?url=/$urltransform=/%3F/?/
/^https?:\/\/(?:[a-z0-9-]+\.)*?dealabs\.digidip\.net\/visit\?url=/$urltransform=/%3D/=/
/^https?:\/\/(?:[a-z0-9-]+\.)*?dealabs\.digidip\.net\/visit\?url=/$urltransform=/^https?:\/\/(?:[a-z0-9-]+\.)*?dealabs\.digidip\.net.*url=([^&]*).*/\$1/
```

The first 4 rules are only for decoding special characters, as the $urltransform tool unfortunately can't do this ([yet](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/CoreLibs/issues/1915)). When it does, these rules could be removed.

KR,





### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body: @imTHAI Please check after filters update.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://chatgpt.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchatgpt.com%2F) ### Comment > ### Bug Report: Sora and Project Folders Disappear When Enabling "Filter HTTPS" in AdGuard > > #### Description > When enabling the **"Filter HTTPS"** option in **Network settings** of AdGuard, the **Sora and Project folders** disappear. This issue occurs consistently when the setting is turned on. > > #### Steps to Reproduce > 1. Open **AdGuard** and go to **Settings**. > 2. Navigate to the **Network** section. > 3. Enable the **"Filter HTTPS"** option. > 4. Observe that the **Sora and Project folders** disappear. > > #### Expected Behavior > The Sora and Project folders should remain visible and accessible even when **"Filter HTTPS"** is enabled. > > #### Actual Behavior > As soon as **"Filter HTTPS"** is enabled, the folders disappear. > > #### Additional Information > - **OS Version**: Win 11 pro Build 26100.3476 > - **AdGuard Version**: 7.20.2 (4988) > > #### Workaround > Disabling **"Filter HTTPS"** restores the Sora and Project folders, but this is not an ideal solution as HTTPS filtering is needed. > Additionally, adding **chatgpt.com** to the **User Filter** does not resolve the issue. > > > Username: `@AbhishekBasnet` ### Screenshots

> [@ih1o2m3e](https://github.com/ih1o2m3e) Вы ошиблись в написании домена. Так можно попасть на фишинговый сайт. Правильный - https://perplexity.ai/

Я не ошибся - iOS по умолчанию не показывает https, а просто имя сайта - если нажать на адресную строку, то появляется полный адрес с https.

Так что с решением проблемы - поправили?

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\

> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/194856
